title: Overpriced and half hearted lazy service
text:
Ate at this restaurant and was pretty disappointed . Wanted to sit inside as we visited in December but the old waitstaff said that there was no seat indoors even though the seats were half empty inside. These seats remained empty for the over 1.5hours we were there . I think he reserved seats for his favorite customers .

We were plonked on a table meant for 4 people but he kept insisting that 5 people could fit in. After finally showing him that it is not possible, he merely said ‘sorry, don’t understand ‘ . That was going to be his favorite phrase the whole evening . After we were squashed on an obviously small table for 4, he passed the menu to us. We ordered our food and later as we asked to remove one order, he resorted to his famous phase ‘sorry don’t understand’ . As we ate the food, we noticed that customers around us were receiving complimentary plates of desserts such as Blakava . We struggled to finish our food and as the helpings were too large, we asked for the food to be packed so that we can give the food to the needy. The old guy grumbled and gave us aluminum foils instead to bring back the food. When we asked for the bill, the guy was insistent that we must tip him. I asked to lay by credit card and he said, ‘sorry, don’t understand ‘ and later card machine not working and insisted on cash .

For a restaurant that caters to Rick steves readers, it amuses me that he doesn’t understand English nor that there is no credit card machine and very ungreek to ask for a tip. I think Rick Steve’s book has spoilt this restaurant and the owner is getting a little big headed. Not an authentic Greek food and we all agreed that this was the must unpleasant and overrated restaurant we have eaten in our stay in Greece. Dont bother to eat, there are better restaurants nearby who treats customers in a respectable manner .

title: Great place to eat where locals eat at wallet friendly prices
text:
Spent €3 per person eating slouvaki at a table in the middle of Athens without burning your wallet. The food here was great that we ended up eating here twice in 2 days . We tried the variety of food and it was cheap and good . We ordered the slouvaki as well as the kebabs and they were delicious together with the white dipping sauce which you eat with French fries . For 5 of us, the bill came to about €30 for a very filling meal. The helping ate huge though .

Service ya efficient and food cones very fast - it gas to as it is always pretty crowded with locals . Good place to eat Greek food .

title: Nice place to wander around in the evenings
text: Very peaceful side lanes, steps and atmospheric restaurants and shops lining this area . Adjacent to it is the Agora area and Acropolis area. Walking up the holly slopes and the touristy shops is part of the Greek experience you only get from this country. Worth going at least once when in Athens. Streets are relatively peaceful and safe compared to other parts of Athens .

title: Nice place to eat Greek food.
text:
Nice place to eat Greek food. We had the usual suspects - Greek Salad, Mousaka , Mutton with pasta, Steamed fish, Blakava, another type of dessert related to Blakava, Greek beer and Greek coffee. Food tasted and looked exactly like Turkish food, but don’t tell that to the Greeks. Fish was rather bony and with the poor lighting ended up eating some bones .

Service was helpful in providing with suggestions. The helpings were relatively large and the 5 of us shared 4 dishes which was more than enough. Paid about €50 for the meal including tips. Nice place to eat at the Plaka area.

title: Good to visit to know more about Corinth
text: Like all old sites in Greece, there is the old sites with all the ruins lying where they laid and nearby will be the museums where the artifacts are stored and displayed to protect them from the elements . The old sites as well as the beta where St Paul was tried by the Roman’s still stand. Temple of Apollo still in ruins but a display of what Corinth looked like in the past was very useful to visualize the magnificence of this place. Worth a visit if you are not templed out after 3 days.

title: Actually not much to see today
text: Looks nice on postcards but is worth perhaps 10 minutes of your time to snap this ancient feat of engineering . Good to visit enroute to other sites and a quick toilet break .

title: Great visit to see the Corinthian city as well as the Bema
text:
Wanted to visit this city for 2 reasons- St Paul’s visit to the Corinthian and his famous letter of love written for the early Christian population in this city . Managed to see that. Another reason was that the Corinthian were a middle power in Ancient Greece compared to the superpower status of Athens and Sparta and we wanted to see what their city looked like in the past .

Place was pretty deserted as we visited it during winter which made it even more atmospheric. Entrance fee was €4 for non EU people . Enjoyed the serenity of the place and the 1€ Canned drinks from the vending machines . Good for a 1.5 hour visit including the attached museum.

title: Great experience eating Greek food
text:
Great experience eating Greek food at this restaurant. Small non descript restaurant near the main pedestrian street that is visited by locals.

Tried the Greek salad, fish balls , cod fish and the quinoa . We had 4 dishes and it filled the 5 of us up completely . Food was delicious and the staff was very helpful who went out of their way to help us . Meal came to about €42 for the 5 of us including drinks. Good place to visit.

title: Expected for centrally located 3 star hotel for €75 a night
text:
Gave 5 stars by virtue of the fact that this hotel is centrally located 3 star hotel that can accommodate a triple room and cost about €85 for the triple and €75 for a double with breakfast included.

The very positive points:
1) very helpful staff who would go out of their way to help you to know more about Athens and who try to accede to your request.
2) centrally located hotel within 10-12 minutes walk of all that is significant in Athens . Think of the hotel as the Centre of a rectangle with the Agora, Acropolis, Temple of Olympian Zeus and Sygtama Square as corners of the rectangle . Very walkable area.
3) Good filling breakfast and polite and proactive staff . These alone meet the excellent ratings .
4) Safe area in Athens

The points below are suggestions for improvements. For a good price I got, I am not complaining about the hotel as it is not a 5 star hotel.
1) poor sound proofing of windows so you hear the sound of the city, garbage trucks and loud Greeks in the middle of the night.
2) Lighting is too dim so difficult to read at night
3) Shower tray always leak out water as the rubber tubing have worn away resulting in Wet bathrooms after every bath.

Will still stay here if looking for a budget family hotel.

title: Don’t bother 8€ admission fees
text: After you have visited the Acropolis €10, Ancient Agora €5 and Acropolis Museum €5 for Non EU residents and during winter period, the €8 admission fee to see a Roman temple ruin is simply ridiculous and won’t understand why people would want to pay that amount of money to visit. Moreover, you need not go inside to see the site as you can merely go near the fenced up area near the entrance after the traffic lights and take a few pictures from there to see the site. Frankly way overpriced for such little to see . Don’t bother . Just take photos from outside .

title: Great place to visit for an hour
text: Decent entrance fee of €5 per person from non EU country . Layout of the place is great with pictures and illustrations highlighting what the place looked like before it was turned into ruins. We enjoyed the visit to the Ancient Agora museum and the special temple to graze at the majesty of this place . In truth, the Agora looks very similar to the Ronan Forum in Rome in terms of similarity of design and size . The site has a good toilet and water fountain as . Remember to visit the temple on the hill to appreciate the layout of the area. It is an 10 minute uphill walk to the Acropolis from here .

title: Cute church that encapsulates Byzantine type of church
text:
Great small church to visit to see a typical Byzantine church with its distinct layout and architecture. May not be the biggest church but the small atmospheric church creates a sense of calmness in the middle of this very busy pedestrian street .

Drop by for a few minutes and appreciate it. Entrance is free but be respectful.

title: Poorly restored building with a modern crane inside it?
text:
This is supposed to be the symbol of Athens but the manner in which the authorities are restoring it is such an eyesore and sad. A historical building with a modern crane nestled in the interior of the pathenon is such an insult- imagine a crane inside the Abraham Lincoln memorial in Washington DCir or the Taj Mahal building in Agra.

I expect the authorities to take better care of these sites but I guess it explains why the Acropolis is not listed as a site of one of the new 7 wonders of the world. They could have done a better job restoring it

title: Pretty expensive to see ruins if you are from a Non EU country
text: Admission fee during winter is €10 per person for above 5 if you are from a non EU country. Pretty expensive to see ruins that should have been better restored . Essentially it is an empty shell as the pollution brought about by the city gas decayed much of the structures more than the invasions, wars this site experienced . The Parthenon was a disgrace as being a super important site to the Western World, has a crane inside the structure that negates and blemishes the importance of the site. It is no wonder the Acropolis did not make it to the list of the new 7 wonders of the world due to the haphazard restoration the site has experienced . Good to visit but you will need to know the backstory of this place to better understand it .

title: Reason why we visit the Vatican Museums
text:
No need to take a guided tour to visit the chapel . Just get an audio guide provided by the museum to get a rough idea of the importance and significance of the Sistine Chapel. Good place to spend 20-30 minutes contemplating the significance of this place and the tender loving care provided to maintain its grandeur.

Unfortunately, there are long lines and is advisable to buy tickets before visiting this site . You will need about 20minutes to take it all in...

title: Excellent hotel centrally located with hospitable hosts
text:
Great hotel to stay when visiting Rome due to its magnificent location, reasonable rates, good comfortable facilities as well as warm and hospitable people.

Location is within walking distance of many central attractions that is accessible by walking or taxi from the nearby taxi stand. Reasonable rates for an otherwise expensive city meant that it is family friendly when you require more than 1 room. Facilities ages also good with warm water, good heating and cooling and sound priced rooms . Lastly the staff is warm, friendly and willing to give a hand to neg arrived out of towners. Assistance provided was also invaluable and very useful . Would stay in this hotel again if visiting Rome .

title: Great museum because of religious significance
text:
Museum worth visiting only because of the Sistine chapel. Sistine chapel is where the popes are elected after the previous pope passes away. Also because of michaelangelo wall and ceiling paintings . This is the reason why you should visit this museum.

All the other attractions - paintings, sculptors etc... are similar to any world class museums. Hence if visiting a world class museum in Italy- this is the museum to visit compared to other Italian museum - similar to Mona Lisa and Louvre Museum Paris, Rosetta Stone in British Museum London and Mummy of Ramses the Second in Egyptian Museum, Cairo .

title: Center of catholic faith with biggest church in the world - enough said .
text:
Most spectacular church you will ever see based on dimensions as well as the gravity of history for this working church. Contains remains of Peter, the first pope, plus the remains of subsequent popes as well as art pieces of Michelangelo called the Pieta. Definitely worth your time to visit.

Just note that outside the church is a completely new world of touts selling imitation stuff and pirate taxis who will fleeced you at the taxi stands charging you 2-3 times above the official rate . These pirate taxis work as a cartel where the route will approach you and give you a jacked up price. The taxi drivers will work in cahoots with these dishonest people as they will get a cut of the profits . Such an irony that after you visit a religious place, you come out to the dishonest practices of these people .

title: Excellent hotel to stay with good breakfast
text:
Originally was given a room that faced the train line which made the rooms noisy between the time of 5am to 0100hrs. This prevented us from sleeping .

Next day, we changed the room and it was much quieter . The air con/heater was powerful. So was the hot water and the bed was very comfortable . Breakfast was great as well with a good long breakfast hours of between 0600-1100hrs on weekends and 0600-1000hrs on weekdays. Price is decent if booked early and a good family place to stay. Highly recommended.
place: Hampton by Hilton Berlin City West

title: Well located, well priced hotel for family trip
text:
Good hotel very near the train station if arriving by train to SMN. It is also a 10minute stroll to the center of Florence and lots of eating places very near the hotel .

Rooms provided are warm, sound proofed and have good warm running water. Breakfast provided is adequate for the day and the price you pay . If traveling on a budget friendly mindset, this hotel is okay since you would not be spending all the time in the hotel if you are visiting Florence .

title: Nice hotel near train station .
text:
Good hotel to stay if it is not too expensive.

We were placed in the rooms on the 5th floor with views of the adjacent church . The rooms were very large as we had a triple room but as we visited in winter, the size of the room and the fact that the rooms are on the top meant that the rooms were always cold .

The heater couldn’t keep the rooms warm, the lightings were a little faulty and when we tried to turn in the bathroom heater at 1 of the rooms, the heater emitted smoke and a plastic burning smell that we had to switch off the heater . The facilities could do with a little more tender living care and maintenance.

The staff were pleasant enough and made the stay more pleasant even though rooms were cold.

title: Great plaza to admire baroque water fountains and have a drink
text:
Very atmospheric place to sip a coffee and people watch as they enjoy the 3 water fountains at this site. Yes the Trevi fountains are famous but super crowded. This site is less crowded due to the much larger site hence it allows you to sit at a fountain-side cafe and face a drink/ meal/ dessert .visited during the day and he was a pleasant place to visit. Do note that the coffee is expensive at €6.50 per cup and water is €5 but guess you are paying for the view . You could also drink water from the city taps and sit by the fountain for similar views and then drink €2 coffee a street behind if you are into a more thrifty mood.

Word of warning, the restaurants are overpriced and they try to tagged additional tips to your final bill even when they already charge 10% service tax .

title: Great architecture and pleasant place to visit
text: Loved visiting this site as it was large but not overbearing . The 142 feet high dome and 142 feet diameter of the building creates almost a perfect symmetry that enhances the beauty of this site. Contains the remains of kings and artists as well . Good 15-20minutes visit to this site to appreciate the wonder of this ancient site commissioned by Octavius Caesar .

title: Good to visit during the day- cleaned up place
text:
Thus area used to be pickpocket central but since the city implemented the non sitting and eating rule as well as patrol the area, the undesirable peddlers and people have vanished .

This area is best visited during the day where the sights are rather striking with the great architecture around the locale. We visited during the night, and the area was not as astounding as the day view.

Spend about 10 minutes in this site will suffice before moving in to other attractions such as the Trevi fountain and pantheon .

title: Visit at night for a better experience
text: Visited the Trevi fountain during the night as well as day. Everyone in our group agreed that the night visit was much better as the area is lighted up and appears a lot more romantic and atmospheric than visiting during the day where it is ‘duller’ with only white marble to see without the illumination. Great architecture as well as sculptors to view and good for a 15 minute visit.

title: Great place to visit if you read up before
text:
To be honest, if you are not aware of the history of Rome, all you see are ruins of buildings that are lost to you and hence will just be a stroll through ruins.

It is advisable to read up and even have pictorial representation of what these buildings were for you to appreciate the significance of these buildings such as the old senate building, temples of various gods to understand how important these buildings are to European architecture design .

Worth a good 1hour to wander around before you get ‘ruined’ out (pun intended).

Can visit the Palestine hill to see the old palaces of emperors such as Nero if you have the energy.

There are water fountains inside as well as WCs to use within the site as well.

title: Book a guided tour with the organization running the place for next experience
text:
Travelled with 3 children and we booked a guided tour by co-op, the company/organization that runs the site . We paid €33 per adult for a tour and €17 for children above 12-18 and €2 for children under 12 that includes a guided tour to the colosseum, a visit to the underground section, the ground floor as well as the third level. These tours allows visitors access to these places that are not available for people buying general admission tickets. The tour provided a very good comprehensive overview of the site as well as awesome photo opportunities from sites that are not congested with visitors . These tours take only a small group and are much more pleasant .

More importantly, it is cheaper than booking for guided tours by companies that bring you to the general area but at twice the price. Other private company are selling the same stuff at €50 but doesn’t bring you to these places such as the underground and third level . Good to purchase these tickets online exactly 2 months before you intent to visit the colosseum to be sure if a place at their official website coopculture.it to get the best deals.

The tickets also include visit to the Forum and the palatine hills as well . Good to visit Colosseum first followed by the forum .

title: Only one grand canal and the reason to visit Venice
text:
This is my third time to Venice, each 20 years apart . Each time we visit Venice, it is for 3 reasons- to visit the Grand Canal, to take a Gondola ride and to visit St Mark Square to see St Mark Church .

In short, take the Grand Canal Cruise by water bus all the way from the train station to St Mark Square . A ticket valid for a 75 minute ride will cost you €7.50 for a 30 minute ride from station to St Mark. After touring St Mark Square and their attractions, make your way back towards the station by foot. Near the Rialto bridge, for the genuine gondola experience (the gondola ride in Las Vegas, Macau is way too inauthentic) hire a gondola for 30 minutes for €80 and tour the small back lanes and the Grand canal area for that Venetian experience . The gondola can sit up to 6 people and for the same price as entrance to the Doge Palace for 6 family pax us much more worthwhile to experience.

Good to visit in the morning or late evening for a less crowded option.

title: Nice church with good interior paintings
text:
When we visited this church, I could have imagined that I was visiting an Eastern Orthodox Church in either Russia, Turkey or Greece.

The interior looks very Eastern Orthodox with striking ceiling and wall paintings. With the remains of Mark the gospel writer entombed within the church- albeit taken /plundered/ stolen from Constinople/ Istanbul many hundred of years ago to justify the legitimacy of the Doges, the church ya still worth visiting to awe at the architecture as well as to visit St Mark. 15 minutes will suffice for this tour. If you need to pay admission to the church, suggest visiting the altar area to have a glider look at the tomb holding the remains of Mark- the other attractions - treasury which contains the said plundered gold from Constinople /Istanbul and the museum to have a balcony view of St Mark’s square have alternative attractions in other cities or within the city .

title: Expensive to visit an empty building
text:
Not the cheapest attraction to visit and really not worth the money to visit. Bought a family tickets for 5 at €65 for a visit of no more than an hour .

When we visited in 2000, the palace had better tapestries as well as a guided tour included in the price. Now it is just entrance fees and the price you pay is more than the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum , Winter Palace in St Petersburg it many other top world attractions .

The palace is essentially an empty shell now and not worth the time nor the lunes to visit. Sad to say, not really worth going to visit Venice for.

title: Great place to reach via a hike from botanical gardens .
text:
We decided to go to Penang hill by the active way- we hiked up and took a tram down.

We started our hike from Moongate 5, at the botanical gardens and took a 3 hour hike up to the top. The first 30 minutes was a killer hike as we had to climb stairs to the Moongate station 5 rest area. After Moongate 5, we used the toilet and washing facilities to freshen up before we hiked about an hour plus in the forest to station 84. The hike was a lot more pleasant as it was shaded and cool moving in higher altitude. At station 84, we reached the 4WD tarmac road and walked the last 2.4km on this toad which took about 45 minutes . When we reached the top, the place was swarming with tourists but we rewarded ourselves with mango snow ice cream for our achievement. We got a discount as we hiked instead of tramming up.

We were too busted at the top as we needed to check out if our hotel by noon. So we took an express lane tram down the hill. The ticket was RM45 per non Malaysian but we needed not to line up and were the first ones to sit at the tram to get the best seats for the views down. The tram ride took 5 minutes to go down while it took us 3 hours to climb.

Was tiring but personally tiring day .

title: Nice place for decent drinks and atmosphere
text: Good place to hang out and enjoy pool views as well as beach views. Good responsive staff who will take the orders from the deck chairs. Staff is polite and obliging. Go there to order the happy hour drinks- around RM21 for alcoholic drinks and slightly cheaper for mocktails. Good place to chill out when you are in holiday .

title: Food ordinary Penang food only
text:
If you wish to eat traditional local food but not the best, then this place is okay .

We only ate at this place because we were a little lazy to take a “grab car” to town to try the local food. This place sold similar food but the quality is average . Pricing is somewhat a little more pricier than the street food due to the tourist location .

Good to get your local fix but nothing to shout about .

title: Good staff giving tender loving care but hotel needs updating .
text:
I gave a good rating to the hotel for the following reasons;

Good:
1) Wonderful staff in all areas- especially the restaurant staff, check in staff and cleaning staff with their warm penangnite hospitality. They will try to accede to your requests and anticipate your needs.
2) Wonderful child minding staff and good range of activities organized by the children’s club . Children had a great time there.
3) Excellent transportation link with hotel Jen , Shangrila hotels with drop off at Gurney Plaza .
4) Reasonably priced food with decent prices at the cafe

Not good:
1) Very poor sound proofing- room 539 was at traffic junction and mosque- forced to sleep only near midnight and wake up by 0550 due to external noise
2) facilities a little run down with a poorly equipped gym and furniture that is very 1980s.
3) broken down or damaged fixtures such as shower hose, chipped furniture .

Will stay here only if wish to go with small children. If not, there will be other choices .

title: Great stay with great staff and facilities
text:
We went there in June that was hot and dry. We chose to do half day tour before retreating to the hotel in the afternoon. To relax by the pool, work out in the gym, eat restaurant food.

The hotel was very decent price which was a plus. Moreover the location was away from Luxor meaning that it was quiet. Also the staff were very helpful and always willing to render their assistance. If there was one issue was that whenever we ordered our meals, somehow the wait staff will mess up in 1 order. Other than that I will return to Hilton Luxor should I return . Also note that this hotel is classified as 5 star but to International standards , more likely four stars .

You can take evening felucca rides from the river bank as well to watch the sunset .

title: Super peaceful visit
text: We went during the late afternoon. The temple was empty and we had the while place to ourselves . As it was partially sheltered , a good place to visit and enjoy looking at this monument in the shade. Entrance fee is 80 Egyptian pounds per person . Go there to look at the wall relief . Buy tickets near the Colossi of Memnon. Good for a 30 minute visit .

title: Don’t bother!!!
text: Super expensive and empty tomb . More expensive then entering the Great Pyramid. Like the great pyramid, it’s interior is small, cramped, empty and claustrophobic. It is 250 Egp per person and not worth your 10 minutes . Don’t bother .

title: Nice but not as big as Karnak
text: Good temple to visit in conjunction with Karnak but a lot smaller . Admission fees is 140EGP per person . Nice wall relief of Ramses the second and interesting fusion of Greek temples and even a mosque within the compound. Bring a tour guide to allow this place to come alive with its history. 30minutes to 1 hour is sufficient in this area.

title: Great visit to this temple
text: We enjoyed visiting the temple because of the story behind this temple with propaganda on how god-like Hatshepsut was. The wall relief and carvings were interesting. Our tour guide from EMO tours did a good job explaining about this temple. As it was in the carvings on the walls of this temple that the tour guide made it come alive
place: Temple of Hatshepsut at Deir el Bahari

title: Reason why we are in Luxor
text: Must see attraction at 200 Egyptian Pounds- the entrance to 3 tombs is rotated . We visited Meranptah, Ramses the 3rd and Ramses the 4th tombs. They were okay tombs for the basic admission tickets . To us, Ramses the 6th tomb was the best but that is a separate tickets at 100 Egyptian pounds . Additionally, the much hyped Tutankhamun tomb was an additional 250 Egyptian pounds which was not worth the admission fees. Photography fee is an additional 300 Egyptian pound . So after counting all the extras, it a really cheap visit . Still go as you come to Egypt for this reason .

title: Reason why we are in Karnak!!!
text: Go for this site with a tour guide to get a true meaning of this site rather than just seeing stones. Entrance fees are decent at 150 Egyptian pounds per person . You need at least 1-2 hours here to understand the story, design and meaning behind this temple . The tour guide, Ash from EMO tours provided a good tour of this area and allowed us to wonder around on our own . A must visit attraction . Just note that the drink stall at this place is super expensive, unlisted and not worth your time to visit .

title: Great tour with Ash for 2 Days
text:
We used EMO tours as they provide good value tours that are inclusive, transparent and good guide .

We booked the East Bank tour as well as the West Bank tour in separate days so as not to get exhausted. The tour guide, Ash provided a good tour that allowed us to see the sites in a more lively manner rather than just looking at stone monuments. The fare we laid was very fair as it is a little more that the admission fees, car with driver as well as refreshments .

The company was very punctual and transparent. We are not interested in visiting the normal tourist shops such as the alabaster and papyrus ‘factories’ and we were not forced nor compelled to visit them .

I recommend this company as they provide decent prices, are transparent, have great guides and have some flexibility . Pay a little more to escape the hassle of booking an independent trip.

If there is one area that can be improved is for the company to allow the customers to
be more flexible in what they wish to see. For example, after a rather quick visit to the valley of the kings , the temple of the Hatshepsut and photo stop at colossi of memnon, we wanted a quick visit to take a few photos of Medinet Habu and the Ramesssseum, which are just 1km away from the colossi of memnon and ticket office, the guide was not able to do that as EMO wanted to charge US$80 just to visit these 2 sites for less than an hour (which is more than the entire half day tour we booked). We were even keen to pay for our own admission tickets and visit the site on our own, without the guide but no go. To Ash’s credit he stopped the car outside these places for a quick 30 second snap before moving off .

We then chose to visit the same 2 sites on the next day on our own and took a 3 hour camel tour with all transportation charges at less than US$80 .

title: Worth a visit, mind the vendors
text: You are in Egypt for this reason . Worth to book a tour with a tour guide to bring out the history of the place . We used EMO tours and were very happy . Secondly, a tour guide will somewhat chase the vendors away allowing you to enjoy your experience with these 4000 year old wonders. Entrance is 150 Egyptian Pounds and you need admission tickets to the pyramids that range from 100 to 240 to enter these pyramids. Descending to to bs is unpleasant, hot and tight. Recommend you visit the pyramids at Saqqara for a more pleasant experience .

title: Good day trips with EMO Tours
text:
Booked all my Day Egypt trips with EMO for the Cairo and Luxor area as well as all the transfers to and from the city airports .

EMO tours ticked all the boxes for our criterion when we book private tours- 1) well priced tours, 2) Transparent pricing 3) Good guides 4) Flexibility based on interest .

1) We looked at other tour agencies and EMO tours were very competitive. They charged good rates and you pay a little extra more for convenience, safety and escape from the hassle of the touts that swarm all the attractions instead of independent self travel .

2) pricing was very transparent with what was included and excluded . After doing a back of envelop calculation, after discounting admission fees , food, car and driver rental, you are simply paying a few dollars more than independent graveling minus the hassle of self travel .

3) We had Mido who was an excellent guide who essentially answered all our questions and who explained all the attractions in Giza and Cairo well . We were very happy with his service and his ability to personalize the trip according to our interest .

4) Mido was aware that we are not interested in those inevitable tourist shops to view perfumes or carpets and respected our decisions not to visit those places . He also entered the itinerary so that we were not exposed to the hottest part of the day and was a good photographer as well .

EMO Tours met our expectations and brought the attractions to Egypt alive. Will recommend to my friends should they choose to visit Egypt . Hence a 5 star review . If there is one area EMO can improve on is their responsiveness to WhatsApp and SMS as they hardly reply to them and it can be quite disconcerting to customers if the intended pickup by their company will happen .

title: 3 star hotel passing off as a 5 star hotel
text:
Pros: hotel has great pyramid view rooms so a high floor with pyramid view rooms are priceless . You are in Cairo for a reason and hence the location of this hotel is key . You can watch the pyramids in the comfort of your room

Cons: 1) Poor and indifferent service: very weird policy of bottled water . If request for 2 bottles of water to be delivered , it is free. If 4 bottles, must pay . As such, must request 2 bottles each time which is a little strange . Also staff lacks initiative and will somewhat always forget your requests.

2) Horrible bathroom - water spills out of the tub and floods the floor . Bath tub is super dirty . Had to change room as first room had a busted door that can’t close .

3)Dirty carpets - place in need of renovation

4) Terrible WiFi - WiFi drops very frequently . For a business hotel - this is unacceptable

5) Exploitative taxi or airport transport . 800 Egyptian pounds for a 1 way ride to airport. Uber cost 200 Egyptian pounds (which you may not get with their horrible WiFi) , tour companies charge 400 Egyptian pounds which means that this is the most value for money and safe option.

Will not stay at this hotel again . Good to simply stay at the room and look at the pyramids as the pool and spa is not welcoming as well .

title: Very romantic, nice view and reasonable prices
text:
I am very weary of restaurants that have very high ranking in TripAdvisor and 90% of the reviews are done by customers who have only a review ad have given 5 stars in order to get freebies from the establishments . If you check some of these restaurants in Istanbul there are quite a number of these establishments. The other 10% of the reviews with more than 5 review will ultimately have a lot less positive reviews and you know that these restaurants are highly suspect .

I am glad to note that this restaurant lives up to its good ranking . The food is well priced and are in fact cheaper than the surrounding touristic restaurants . The atmosphere is very romantic with great views of the Bosphorus and Hagia Sophia - very romantic at night. Thirdly the evening entertainment was of good quality and we enjoyed the great singer . Lastly, the food is good to the extent that we visited the restaurant 3 times - once eating at this restaurant and the other 2 times visiting the sultaniah restaurant of their sister restaurant that essentially serves most of the same food and similar prices . The kebab and meats are great . Will visit when returning to Istanbul .

title: Half attractions are closed but they still charge full price!!!
text: This museum is supposed to house oriental artifacts and Greek artifacts . However what we wanted to see are all closed for renovations. Instead of planning to spent 3 hours be prepared to spent no more than 1 hour. The treaty of Kadesh as well as Sumerian, Mesopotamian and Assyrian collections were good . The attraction cost 30 Turkish Lira each .

title: Nice cruise on the Bosphorus. Short visit suffice.
text:
A very nice and pleasant cruise along this water body . No need to book and pay 20 € for a 1.5 hour cruise when you can actually do the same by booking the 25 Turkish Lira on a Turyol ferry. It is exactly the same tour but at 1/5 the price . The turyol boats leave every hourly and after or before the tour, can visit the nearby spice market for some wi die or real shopping .

Always sit on the left side of the boat fir the best and romantic view. Go anytime during the day or evening .

title: Crowded and hot . Prepared to get lost and be lost in bargaining
text: If you are a tourist visiting this bazaar to get a local experience, this attraction is a place you will want to visit. It is a bustling area but do note that it is largely enclosed area with a roof that makes it a few degree hotter than the surrounding area. Also note that the vendor are relentless but will politely leave you alone if you decline or just ignore them . Be prepared to bargain hard. 1-2 hours will suffice. However be prepared to be hopelessly lost in this large market . Ask the bank money changers for direction to the correct tram stop once you finish visiting as in 90% of likelihood, you are lost and there is no proper internet or wife in the area.

title: Nice mid day stopover with reasonable price entry.
text: This is essentially a 30minute attraction visit just across the road from Harris Sofa. It is quieter, darker, cooler and unique experience to walk around the column of pillars to look at the various pillars and their Medusa heads . Entrance fee is 20 Lira so pretty decent entry fee . Visit it as an attraction but not as the attraction in Istanbul . 30 minutes is more than enough .

title: Under renovation so need to imagine
text: Visited the mosque in the evening . One of the biggest mosque and you will need to cover up your heads, shoulders and knees . The courtyard and interior of the mosque are worth visiting . Just note that the central section is completely closed off and hence the interior does not look overwhelming. You only get to see up to the second tier of dimes and not the main dome . Better when renovations are done .

title: Nice museum but be aware of renovation
text: It is a nice place to visit but pretty expensive at 70 Turkish Lira per person. You can book the tickets by lining up which can take up to 1 hour, buy a fast pass and pay twice or take a guided tour and pay lots more for a 1 hour visit. The attraction is good for a 1-2 hour visit that highlights the Byzantine and Islamic culture . Nice image to wander around and admire. The tour can be done on your own or by borrowing a guide book. Nice visit but best time is after opening or closing .

title: Nice palace but large sections closed
text:
I feel that the whole of Istanbul is undergoing renovation. We paid full price of 60 Lira plus an additional 35 Lira to visit both the palace as well as the harem. Unfortunately half the attractions are closed . Why bother to visit the harem, when the quarters of the harem are closed . Why bother to visit the palace treasures when the imperial treasures as well as the salons room are all closed ? Moreover they still charge full price when the main biggies are all closed .

Still spent about 2.5hours visiting the place mainly because of the need to line up to visit the Islamic artifacts .

Go on mate afternoon to get the smallest crowds . If not, around 10am

title: Expected stay but tone down on overly promoting on TripAdvisor
text:
I have been reviewing my trips for the past 9 years in TripAdvisor and basically know what type of hotel stay I desire.

If you like a boutique hotel with great hospitality, middle of the road prices, comfortable and clean rooms, romantic atmosphere , excellent central location where all attractions and public transport options are walking distance, this hotel and the surrounding hotels will be an ideal location.

This hotel ticks all the correct criterion and that was why I chose it and gave it a 5 star review.

It is just that the hotel staff keeps trying to promote the hotel and blatantly ask to give 5 stars so that they will be ranked amongst the top hotels in Istanbul that it can be very tiresome . It is this reason that their sister hotels and their attached restaurants are all consistently ranked as amongst the top hotels and restaurants in TripAdvisor . Just be aware of that it is very sad that a website originally intended to help independent tourists have become so commercialized and exploited as a free marketing tool that it somewhat takes away the beauty of this hotel .

I still give it a 5 star ranking as will their restaurants - Anatolian olive and sultaniah restaurant as I ate there but please stop trying to ask customers to give them 5 star rankings. It is unethical .

title: Great comfortable stay at a good location
text: Stay at the hotel was great as it was in a great location . Besides the location, we enjoyed the stay as the rooms were nice and warm with good inroom control of heating/cooling . The toilets were kept spotlessly clean and the warm shower felt very good after a day touring the city. The service staff were great and hospitable who will go the way out to help you . Didn’t eat the hotel breakfast as there were better breakfast options outside in terms of pricing and the fact that we were tired of hotel breakfasts such as Paul’s and local cafes . Was near the famous white rabbit restaurant, arbat street for shopping and 1 metro stop away from the main entrance to the kremlin . The room was well decorated and they provided champagne and strawberry to celebrate our anniversary as well . Will stay at thus hotel if I return to Moscow .

title: Great food, nice ambience and decent prices
text:
Had a great dinner at the white rabbit and understand why it is amongst the top restaurant in the world.

The food was simply great. Enjoyed the black beluga caviar at only 2200r per person . The burgundy wine was smooth and well worth the 800roubles per glass . We ate the beef tartare and he was great. Likewise the main dishes of duck and beef was simply outstanding . We enjoyed the last part- which was the dessert and they were simply great. The whole bill came to €90 for 2 which is considered great value for the type of food we ate. Ambience was great though finding the place may be a little tricky .

If I had 1 complaint, it will be that the tables are spaced too close to each other but it is a relatively small restaurant . Will visit again if I return to Moscow .

title: Great efficient and comfortable trip
text:
The Sapsan train is a great way to travel from the 2 major cities in Russia . The journey takes almost 4 hours but the ride is very comfortable and the seats great. The compartments are well heated, the toilets are clean and the food choices are reasonable though the taste is not the best.

You will need to clear security twice but I will take this option from Moscow to St Petersburg or vice-verse due to the convenience of the train as it starts and terminates at the train station unlike the airports. Moreover the price is only about US$38 person and is very good value . Taking a plane will set you back by twice the amount, stringent security but squashy seats on top of paying Yandex or Uber an exploitative amount for rides to and from the airports. Will use the Sapsan option in subsequent trips .

title: Great display of important artifacts . Go for it!!!
text: The armory limits numbers to 200 per session and with great reason . The armory has a total of about 10 rooms and each room is laden with important artifacts such as faberge eggs, armory worn by tsars, carriages drivers by royalty that is is a great place to admire these artifacts uninterrupted and with less crowds to admire these pieces. Limiting numbers makes the place more enjoyable at your own pace . The audio guides provided were very useful. You are given 1.5hours at the armory based on the timing provided . The tour will easily take up 1.5hours and at 300 roubles , it is great value to visit. Book the tickets 17 days in advance to be assured of your tickets. Will visit again if returning to Miscow

title: Unusual visit but great tour to admire Soviet era Art
text:
Paid 55 doubles per son to see various stops to admire the interiors of the metro . Took line 3 to see 4 great metro stations- ploshchad revolution for the bronze statues and the cute dogs , arbat station for the soviet era designs, kiev station for Ukraine murals and Peabody station for Russian victories over her enemies . You just need to get off at selected stations and admire their work of art and culture .

Another advantage of taking the metro is that you will arrive at your destination a lot faster than taxi or Uber . Took me 50 minutes to reach a particular destination on line 3. If I took the metro, I would have reached it in 12 minutes . Great people mover and for propaganda’s purposes .

title: Great pleasant stay in great location
text:
My favorite hotel in the city . Staff is very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. They were polite and helpful throughout our stay.

The beds and bathroom was super comfortable and we had a great hot shower during the cold winter and slept in the warm comfy bed with very little problem . The breakfast spread was great with local dishes and champagne- sparkling wine. Both of us wished that we could have stayed longer here . They also provided full range of toiletries and bath robes as well as slippers.

title: Great place for Russian food
text:
Had a great lunch at this restaurant. It is only 400m away from the obelisk in the winter palace and very accessible from that palace .

The food we ordered were great and of decent value. We ordered black caviar accompanied by vodka, two types of soup, traditional main course Of chicken Kiev and water. We enjoyed the food we ate.

The staff are very friendly and helpful, the place is well heated and they kept us welcomed throughout the meal. Will eat here again if I visit the city again . Whole vill came to about 4500rues for entire meal.

title: Go for the tower view and visit the church
text:
The climb up to the tower takes 5-10 minutes up 260 steps. Entrance fee is 250roubles and you are provided with a good paranomic view of the city from the towers .

The walk inside the interior was even more awe inspiring with all the gold that have been used to create a very ostentatious church with all its gold ornaments and cover that you realize why the locals rebelled . The interior is much more prettier than those of the church of the spilled blood due to its grandeur and design . The entrance fee to the church is 150 roubles per person .

title: Decent place to chill out with nice food at reasonable prices
text:
The central location is a big plus to this cafe. Go for the lunch deal for Russian food as they are good value for money with 480roubles for a 3 course meal from 1100-1600hrs.

The coffee is good, the place well heated and strong Wi-Fi . Ideal place to people watch and the toilets are well maintained. Good place to have tea or your meals . Will go there is return to St Petersburg

title: Don’t bother - if interested in its history, go at around 4pm on weekends for the Rasputin tour.
text: Their place is just like any palaces in St. Petersburg. If you have visited Winter Palace, give this place a miss as the admission prices are similar. I came to this place for the Rasputin tour but do note that the tour starts at 1700-1800hrs on weekends only. The tour is 1 hour long but you spend 20 minutes watching a video about Rasputin’s murder before they bring you to the 2-3 significant rooms in the basement with kitschy mannequins in those rooms . Paid about 300 doubles for the Rasputin tour but we left after 15 minutes as it was a very boring tour . Not worth your time visiting .

title: Great hotel for visiting the city when booked at decent prices
text:
This hotel is a great stay if you wish to visit central Helsinki as it is in an absolutely good locale- at the train station and good connections via the trams to any other part of Helsinki. As it is very near the terminus where all the tram lines congregate , great location

The staff are very friendly and helpful and will point you to the correct places you wish to go.

The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are great in terms of heated floors during winter, good in-room heating and a proper shower tray that spews water out of the bath area and gets the whole toilet wet which Scandinavian hotels have a bad habit of doing it with their minimal showers tray coverage

Only downside was that the breakfast could have been more comprehensive but I ought not be complaining too much as that would be nit picking.

For the price of US$150 a night for a twin bedded room inclusive breakfast for 2, it is a good stay with great value.

title: Average restaurant with Finnish Food and kitschy stuff
text:
Ate at this restaurant as wanted Finnish bliny and creamy salmon soup. The food is quite decent and typically priced in Helsinki . Enjoyed the fish soup but the bliny felt more like fat pancakes but I guess that is the traditional way it us cooked.

Service was good and attentive . Nice experience eating Finnish food for that feeling.

title: A decent ferry to bring you across to Tallinn
text:
Chose this ferry line as they have the must frequent sailings as well as the fastest sailing at 2 hours compared to 2.5hours for Viking lines that us longer and even fewer sailings .

It serves as a quick getaway to Estonia and the food offering on board the ship us basic and functional . A rather satisfactory way to visit Tallinn. If I had to quibble about the line, it would be hrs obscure location away from central Helsinki. You need to take tram 6T and 7 from the Central Railway Station to the West terminal which us very out of the way. Also its location at Tallinn is also a bit out of the way compared to the other cruise lines .

title: Nice hub of transportation
text: Great place to base yourself at one of the surrounding hotels as you are right in the hub- the trains, buses, trams all originate and terminate at this area as well as the departmental stores surround the station . Also the architecture is pretty post modern and Soviet looking but it adds to the attractiveness of the building . A very functional place rather than an attraction .

title: It us just an empty square !!
text: Nothing much to see here as it us essentially a place where they set up a Christmas market and a portable Suana. However, compared to the main squares in Copenhagen, Stockholm and even Tallinn, this is most certainly the most boring square and one of the smallest as well. Worth a photo stop to take a few Khufu’s before moving on to other attractions .

title: Pretty small market hall for tourists
text: Visited this market hall in the morning. There are about 30-40 shops selling fresh produce and food though it caters more to the tourists. In fact, the food seem more expensive here than other places as I guess they are more tourist orientated that middle eastern as well as Vietnamese food are sold as well. I visited the Stockmen department stall gourmet level and the variety of food at the departmental stall are more varied as well as cheaper. Hence don’t bother visiting this site if you are visiting Stockmen.

title: Nice church from the outside
text:
A very iconic church that is very eye catching as it is located on a hill at debate square with its cute green colour.

Other than that, the interior is pretty austere and functional. A nice place to drop by for 10-15 mi jets before moving on to other sites. Sites in Helsinki are pretty limited .

title: Seriously overpriced to see an empty church
text:
How can this attraction be an attraction? You pay €3 to enter a church that is essentially dynamited out from rock. Being a church, personally I am against paying to enter a place of worship and I do t see why there is a need to pay an admission price to visit this place.

Didn’t no more than 5 -10 minutes and we were bored . Don’t waste your time going here .

title: Excellent way to get around Helsinki during cold weather
text:
Helsinki is a very walkable city and you need not spend money paying for expensive taxis going from point A to B.

The team lines are pretty well organized - I think there are up to 9 tram lines and they all cross cross each other especially near the train station. As such, this hub and spoke method allows you to easily go from point A to B it be city at a very rapid time . Buy the day pass at €9 for 24 hours of travel and you get to see all the sites within the city by that time . A very economical way to travel. During winter time when it us snowing, it is a good alternative to walking . Buy the tickets from the kiosks or from ticket machines .

title: Pretty Christmas market in December
text: Nice Christmas market at the town square with a very carnival like atmosphere. It makes the town a lot liver. The lighting at night creates a romantic atmosphere as well when you walk along the cobbled streets . Food and shops are pretty reasonable priced compared to the other Nordic countries which explains why the place is jammed jacked with Finnish people getting their alcohol fix enroute as well as in Tallinn .

title: Pleasant and atmospheric place in December
text:
Went there by Tallink ferry from Helsinki and spent 3 hours in the old town . If you wish to walk around, 3 hours will suffice. But if you wish to visit their museums as well as have a sit down dinner and tea, you will certainly need a full day .

Personally, more sights to see than Helsinki. The Christmas market area is pretty pleasant and more lively than the Helsinki area. Just note that if you are taking a ferry, it is about a 1km hike to Fat Margaret - which is the entrance to the old town as the area is under renovation and lots of detours abound. Hence quite tiring walking there and back and walking on the cobbles streets can be painful to your feet . If I were to return there, will probably spent the whole day there or even an overnight stay .

title: Nice place to learn about Sami Culture as well as to sleigh ride
text:
Yes this place is super touristy with about two hundred tourists descending a day and the reindeers are super adorable, cute and gentle.

Yes the price can be super expensive but this is Norway and besides hunting the Northern lights. Sleighing in either a reindeer or a pack of dogs, there is not much left to do in this city . Nevertheless we enjoyed ourselves a lot on this short tour and is a once in a lifetime experience.

Do remember to do the sleigh rides and you will have fun.

title: Loved the lunch and dessert here!!
text: Great place to chill out here from the cold. They had a wonderful fish and mussel soup that we both enjoyed very much . It was pretty filling for the 2 of us. The dessert - the cheesecake dessert was super delicious and we both scrapped off the plate all the crumbs from the cake. Very friendly, cosy place to stay warm. Will visit again if I return .

title: Got to see what we came to see for both nights
text:
Booked this company as they have a good reputation for being persistent in chasing the light. Managed to see the lights on both nights and luckily all near Tromso and need not have to drive to Finland. Booked the big bus tour because of my personality style .

1) has a toilet that is clean onboard

2) strong WiFi that keeps you connected

3) heated bus if you are the type who can’t tolerate cold too long

4) decent value since a big bus tour is about 60% that of a small bus tour - so good if you are watching your wallet and traveling with family

5) Not a very sociable person and prefer to travel with 30 over people and need not talk 2-3 hours over a fire with your fellow travelers in a small group

6) provide the same type of service as the small group tour- photography, same enthusiasm, same service and after sale services.

Based on these criterion, chasing lights delivered on all of these and we left very happy with the services they provided .

If I return to Tromso or if my friends recommend from me which tour to take, I will not hesitate to recommend this tour hands down !!!

title: Basic hotel that meets your basic demands
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights and was a decent hotel that provided full board for your stay.

Positives:
1) Full board provided for breakfast, tea and a light dinner . Can be a money saver if you are watching your wallet for the super expensive tours you take to hunt the northern lights as well as the US$12 Burger King meals.

2) Hospitable staff that were polite and helped you with the queries

3) Near a central location so walking distance to any part of Tromsø are just a few minutes away.

4) Go for twin bedded rooms as they are bigger and more room to walk around

Negatives:
1) super small and basic gym that has machines that are old, faulty or inadequate to do proper work outs. The gym / sauna is not working and people who have checked out but need to wash up will use the bathing facilities there . So a bit awkward to work out whilst people are changing or bathing in the same room

2) House keeping could be on top of their game by providing full range of soap, towels, mats but somehow these are missing on some days .

3) Beds are somewhat lumpy and soft
